ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BACK=n ] 
      
Specifies the number of observations before the end of the data where the
multistep forecasts are to begin.

[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set ] 
      
names the SAS data set that contains the input data for the procedure to
forecast.

[Syntax: ERRORCONTROL= ( SEVERITY= ( severity-options ) STAGE= ( stage-options ) MAXMESSAGE=number ) ] 
      
Prefixes the model specification file name or the model selection list file
name or both.

[Syntax: EXCEPTIONS=except-option ] 
      
Specifies the desired handling of arithmetic exceptions during the run.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that PROC HPFENGINE stop on an arithmetic exception. No recovery is attempted.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that PROC HPFENGINE generate a forecast based on using its default exponential  smoothing model for the variable that produces the arithmetic exception in the current  BY group.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that PROC HPFENGINE generate a forecast based on a zero-drift random walk model  for the variable that produces the exception in the current BY group.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Specifies that PROC HPFENGINE generate a forecast of missing values for the variable  that produces the exception in the current BY group.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: GLOBALSELECTION=catalog-name ] 
      
Specifies the name of a catalog entry that serves as a model selection list.

[Syntax: IGNORECHOOSE ] 
      
Specifies that the CHOOSE= option in the HPFSELECT procedure be ignored when
selecting a model in the candidate model list.

[Syntax: INEST=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Contains information that maps forecast variables to models or selection lists,
and data set variables to model variables.

[Syntax: INEVENT=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Contains information that describes predefined events.

[Syntax: LEAD=n ] 
      
Specifies the number of periods ahead to forecast (forecast lead or horizon).

[Syntax: OUT=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain the forecasts of the variables specified
in the subsequent FORECAST statements.

[Syntax: OUTCOMPONENT=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain the forecast components.

[Syntax: OUTEST=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Contains information that maps forecast variables to model specifications, and
data set variables to model variables and parameter estimates.

[Syntax: OUTFOR=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain the forecast time series components
(actual, predicted, lower confidence limit, upper confidence limit, prediction
error, and prediction standard error).

[Syntax: OUTINDEP=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain input in the forecasting process.

[Syntax: OUTMODELINFO=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain detailed information about the selected
forecast model.

[Syntax: OUTPROCINFO=SAS-data-set ] 
      
Names the output data set to contain information in the SAS log, specifically
the number of notes, errors, and warnings and the number of series processed,
forecasts requested, and forecasts failed.

[Syntax: OUTSTAT=SAS-data-set ]
      
Names the output data set to contain the statistics of fit
(or goodness-of-fit statistics).

[Syntax: OUTSTATSELECT=SAS-data-set ]
      
Names the output data set to contain statistics of fit for all of the candidate
models fit during model selection.

[Syntax: PLOT=option | (options ) ]
      
Specifies the graphical output desired. By default, the HPFENGINE procedure
produces no graphical output.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Plots prediction error time series graphics.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Plots prediction error autocorrelation function graphics.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Plots prediction error partial autocorrelation function graphics.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Plots prediction error inverse autocorrelation function graphics.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Plots the forecast in the forecast horizon only.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip10: Plots model and error graphics for each candidate model fit to the series forecast series.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip11: Specifies all of the preceding PLOT= options.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PRINT=option | (options ) ]
      
Specifies the printed output desired. By default, the HPFENGINE procedure
produces no printed output.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Prints the results of parameter estimation.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Prints the performance statistics for each forecast.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Prints the performance summary for each BY group.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Prints the performance summary for all of the BY groups.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Prints the label and fit statistics for each model in the selection list.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip11: Prints parameter estimates for each candidate model fit to the series forecast series.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip12: Prints descriptive statistics the series forecast series.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip13: The same as specifying PRINT=(ESTIMATES SELECT FORECASTS STATISTICS BIAS DESCSTATS).

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PRINTDETAILS ]
      
Specifies that output requested with the PRINT= option be printed in greater
detail.

[Syntax: REPOSITORY=catalog-name ]
      
Is a two-level SAS catalog name that specifies the location of the model
repository.

[Syntax: SCOREREPOSITORY=catalog-name | libref ]
      
Is a two-level SAS catalog name that specifies the location of the model score repository.

[Syntax: SEASONALITY=n ]
      
Specifies the length of the seasonal cycle.

[Syntax: SORTNAMES ]
      
Specifies the length of the seasonal cycle.

[Syntax: TASK=option ]
      
Controls the model selection and parameter estimation process.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Performs model selection, estimates parameters of the selected model, and produces forecasts.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Estimates parameters by using the model specified in the INEST= data set, then forecasts.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Estimates parameters by using the model specified in the INEST= data set, then forecasts.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Forecasts using model and parameters specified in the INEST= data set. No parameter estimation occurs.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ADJUST variable = ( variable-list ) / options ;
      
The ADJUST statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set whose
accumulated values are used to adjust the dependent values. Adjustments can be
performed before and/or after forecasting. A particular forecast variable can
be referenced by multiple forecast statements.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OPERATION=(preadjust, postadjust ) ] 
      
Specifies how the adjustments are applied to the forecast variable.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No adjustment operation is performed. This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Variables listed in the adjustment statement are added to the dependent variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Variables listed in the adjustment statement are subtracted from the dependent variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Dependent variable is multiplied by variables listed in the adjustment statement.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Dependent variable is divided by variables listed in the adjustment statement.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Dependent variable is set to the minimum of the dependent variable and all variables listed in the adjustment statement.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Dependent variable is set to the maximum of the dependent variable and all variables listed in the adjustment statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period
for the variables listed in the ADJUST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: None
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Total
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Minimum

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the
accumulated time series for variables listed in the ADJUST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Average
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Median

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRIMMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the ADJUST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No missing value trimming is applied.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning missing values are trimmed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either actual or
accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series for variables
listed in the ADJUST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that 
immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period
for the variables listed in the CONTROL statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: None
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Total
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Minimum

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: EXTEND=option ] 
      
Specifies how future values of the control variables are set.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Future values are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Future values are set to the mean of the values in the fit range. This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Future values are set to the first value found in the fit range.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Future values are set to the last value found in the fit range.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Future values are set to the minimum of the values in the fit range.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Future values are set to the maximum of the values in the fit range.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Future values are set to the median of the values in the fit range.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the
accumulated time series for variables listed in the CONTROL statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Average
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Median

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRIMMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the CONTROL statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No missing value trimming is applied.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning missing values are trimmed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either actual or
accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series for variables
listed in the CONTROL statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: EXTERNAL variable-list / options ;
      
The EXTERNAL statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set whose
accumulated values are used as predicted values for an external model. It can
also list prediction standard errors and lower and upper confidence intervals.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the
accumulated time series for variables listed in the EXTERNAL statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Average
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Median

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRIMMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from the accumulated time series for variables listed in the EXTERNAL statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No missing value trimming is applied.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning missing values are trimmed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either actual or
accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series for variables
listed in the ADJUST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period
for the variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: None
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Total
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Minimum

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: NOREPLACE ] 
      
specifies that the forecast value in the OUTFOR= data set be set to missing
when a corresponding historical value is missing.

[Syntax: REPLACEMISSING ] 
      
Specifies that embedded missing actual values be replaced with one-step-ahead
forecasts in the OUT= data set. The inverse behavior of this option, applied to
the OUTFOR= data set, is NOREPLACE.

[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the
accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Average
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Median

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRIMMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No missing value trimming is applied.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning missing values are trimmed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either actual or
accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series for variables
listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ID variable < options > ;
      
The ID statement names a numeric variable that identifies observations in the
input and output data sets. The ID variable’s values are assumed to be SAS
date, time, or datetime values. In addition, the ID statement specifies the
(desired) frequency associated with the actual time series. The ID statement
options also specify how the observations are accumulated and how the time ID
values are aligned to form the actual time series. The information specified
affects all variables specified in subsequent FORECAST statements. If the ID
statement is specified, the INTERVAL= option must also be specified. If an ID
statement is not specified, the observation number (with respect to the BY
group) is used as the time ID.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No accumulation occurs; the ID variable values must be equally spaced with respect  to the frequency. This is the default option.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Observations are accumulated based on the total sum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Observations are accumulated based on the average of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Observations are accumulated based on the minimum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Observations are accumulated based on the median of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Observations are accumulated based on the maximum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Observations are accumulated based on the number of nonmissing observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Observations are accumulated based on the number of missing observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Observations are accumulated based on the number of observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip10: Observations are accumulated based on the first of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip11: Observations are accumulated based on the last of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip12: Observations are accumulated based on the standard deviation of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip13: Observations are accumulated based on the corrected sum of squares of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip14: Observations are accumulated based on the uncorrected sum of squares of their values.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALIGN=option ] 
      
Controls the alignment of SAS dates that are used to identify output observations.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Middle

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: END=option ] 
      
Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the end of the
data. If the last time ID variable value is less than the END= value, the
series is extended with missing values.

[Syntax: FORMAT=option ] 
      
Specifies a SAS format that is used for the DATE variable in the output data
sets. The default format is the same as that of the DATE variable in the DATA=
data set.

[Syntax: HORIZONSTART=option ] 
      
Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the start of the
forecast horizon.

[Syntax: INTERVAL=interval ] 
      
Specifies the frequency of the input time series.

[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the accumulated time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing values are set to missing. This is the default option.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Missing values are set to the accumulated average value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Missing values are set to the accumulated minimum value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Missing values are set to the accumulated median value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Missing values are set to the accumulated maximum value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Missing values are set to the accumulated first nonmissing value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Missing values are set to the accumulated last nonmissing value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Missing values are set to the previous accumulated nonmissing value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Missing values are set to the next accumulated nonmissing value.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: START=option ] 
      
Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the beginning of the data.

[Syntax: TRIMMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No missing value trimming is applied.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning missing values are trimmed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either actual or
accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period
for the variables listed in the INPUT statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: None
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Total
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Minimum

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: REQUIRED=YES | NO ] 
      
Enables or disables a check of inputs to models.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the input variables be included in the model as long as the model  does not fail to be diagnosed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the input variables be included in the model as long as their  parameters are significant and the increment of the value of criterion exceeds  a threshold.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the
accumulated time series for the variables listed in the INPUT statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Average
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Median

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRIMMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the INPUT statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No missing value trimming is applied.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning missing values are trimmed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either actual or
accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series for variables
listed in the INPUT statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BASENAME=SAS-name ] 
      
Prefixes the score file name with the specified value.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: STOCHASTIC variable-list / options;
      
The STOCHASTIC statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set
whose accumulated values are used as stochastic input in the forecasting
process.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCUMULATE=option ] 
      
Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period
for the variables listed in the STOCHASTIC statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No accumulation occurs; the ID variable values must be equally spaced with respect  to the frequency. This is the default option.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Observations are accumulated based on the total sum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Observations are accumulated based on the average of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Observations are accumulated based on the minimum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Observations are accumulated based on the median of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Observations are accumulated based on the maximum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Observations are accumulated based on the number of nonmissing observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Observations are accumulated based on the number of missing observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Observations are accumulated based on the number of observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip10: Observations are accumulated based on the first of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip11: Observations are accumulated based on the last of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip12: Observations are accumulated based on the standard deviation of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip13: Observations are accumulated based on the corrected sum of squares of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip14: Observations are accumulated based on the uncorrected sum of squares of their values.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SELECTION=option ] 
      
Specifies the selection list used to forecast the stochastic variables.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No accumulation occurs; the ID variable values must be equally spaced with respect  to the frequency. This is the default option.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Observations are accumulated based on the total sum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Observations are accumulated based on the average of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Observations are accumulated based on the minimum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Observations are accumulated based on the median of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Observations are accumulated based on the maximum of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Observations are accumulated based on the number of nonmissing observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Observations are accumulated based on the number of missing observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Observations are accumulated based on the number of observations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip10: Observations are accumulated based on the first of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip11: Observations are accumulated based on the last of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip12: Observations are accumulated based on the standard deviation of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip13: Observations are accumulated based on the corrected sum of squares of their values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip14: Observations are accumulated based on the uncorrected sum of squares of their values.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: REQUIRED=YES | NO ] 
      
Enables or disables a check of inputs to models.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Checks are not performed and no inputs are dropped from a model.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Inputs are checked and those with errors, or those judged collinear, are dropped  from the model for the current series and task only.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: REPLACEMISSING ] 
      
Specifies that embedded missing actual values be replaced with one-step-ahead forecasts in the STOCHASTIC variables.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Checks are not performed and no inputs are dropped from a model.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Inputs are checked and those with errors, or those judged collinear, are dropped  from the model for the current series and task only.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SETMISSING=option | number ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are assigned in the 
accumulated time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Missing values are set to missing. This is the default option.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Missing values are set to the accumulated average value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Missing values are set to the accumulated minimum value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Missing values are set to the accumulated median value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Missing values are set to the accumulated maximum value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Missing values are set to the accumulated first nonmissing value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Missing values are set to the accumulated last nonmissing value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Missing values are set to the previous accumulated nonmissing value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Missing values are set to the next accumulated nonmissing value.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRIMMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how missing values (either actual or accumulated) are trimmed from
the accumulated time series for variables listed in the FORECAST statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No missing value trimming is applied.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning missing values are trimmed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending missing value are trimmed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ZEROMISS=option ] 
      
Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either actual or
accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Beginning and/or ending zeros unchanged.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Beginning zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Ending zeros are set to missing.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.
